meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh cry or yell.
meanings.sent1: The baby was yawling loudly for attention.
meanings.sent2: The coyote was yawling in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started yawling when it saw its reflection.
meanings.sent4: The sirens of the ambulance were yawling through the night.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm sounded like it was yawling angrily.

meanings.definition: A loud, harsh cry or yell.
meanings.sent1: The yawling of the cat woke up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The yawling of the wind echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The yawling of the monkey made everyone laugh at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The yawling of the alarm filled the room with urgency.
meanings.sent5: The yawling of the thunder made the children cover their ears.
